Benedict Cumberbatch tries Kimbap for the first time, Pom Klementieff is mind blown by Korean pears, Tom Holland falls in love with Korean Banana Milk and Tom Hiddleston may have the smoothest voice in history. This week we have the privilege of filming with 4 members of the cast of Avengers Infinity War!!

With a busy schedule of press interviews in their hotel, we wanted to give them all a unique, fun Korean experience during their stay. So we put together a set and chose a variety of homely Korean food that we know foreigners love from our previous videos, that also fit the actors' dietary requirements. Kimbap from two of my favourite Kimbap joints in Seoul, the sort of Kimbap bursting with fillings and flavour, that makes me question how on earth Kimbap isn't known around the world. And fresh juicy Korean fruit that is unlike anything we have in the UK. 

This is Avengers trying Korean food!


Huge thanks to everyone involved in the creation of this video:

Technical Director/Editor: Mike Kim
Editor/Translator: Sejun Lee

This week we bring Korean BBQ to the UK!! You can find Korean BBQ her but itâ€™s not the same, and so many of our friends hadnâ€™t tried it that we decided to make our own authentic Korean BBQ with them! Juicy Pork Belly, grilled kimchi, incredible ssamjang sauce and the perfect mix of veg combining to make an experience you won't forget. Meat will never taste the same after you try legit Korean BBQ... there's no going back.

Last year we introduced Korean BBQ to this British football team, and this year, with the help of Gabie and our favourite chicken shop in the UK, we brought them my favourite food to have after a good game of footie: Korean Fried Chicken!

Huge thank you to Hashtag United for giving us their time and letting us film. Go check them out here:

Big thanks as well to Gabie for helping us prepare the chicken fresh and perfectly for them! Check out her channel here: https://www.youtube.com/user/gkook1

We got the original chicken and sauces from Itaewon Burger and Chicken and the spicy Volcano sauce from Pelicana.

For more information on the Coupang Play Series click here!  https://coupangplay.app.link/N2wx1MRKfqb

Hello! So last week we uploaded a little preview, and this is the full video of Americans trying Korean ice creams for the first time! We filmed this while travelling in LA, and went out on a hot day and just gave ice creams to people that we met on the street! These are all ice creams that I grew to love in Korea, but we had no idea how the people we met would react, so it was great to see their honest reactions!! Also, Ollie hadnâ€™t tried any of these ice creams before either, so before we started filming with people on the street we filmed Ollie trying them all one by one - so thatâ€™s why his reactions are all mixed in with the rest!! 

Enjoy!!

Dylan O'Brien. Ki Hong Lee. Thomas Brodie-Sangster. Today the actors of Maze Runner are in Korea, and we get a chance in the midst of their busy press tour, to take them out for some real Korean BBQ Pork Belly (and a few shots of Soju!). 
We find out about how Ki Hong has introduced the others to Korean food in the past, how they had a history starting on Youtube, and of course what they think about Korean BBQ, Kimchi Jjigae, and Dwenjang Sulbab! 
What a perfect way to put Sho and Andy's recommendation for foreigner's coming to Korea to the test! Enjoy!!

Also - *SPECIAL ANNOUNCEMENT* - JOLLY Merch is here!!!!!!!

Right now unfortunately we can only ship to Korea, but internationally shipping will be coming VERY SOON! Stay tuned for more info!

In a ram packed press schedule, doing press interviews back to back all day, we wanted to introduce him to a bit of Korean culture, and use the 12 minute interview slot we had to do something a bit different! So we talked to his people, and although 12 minutes wasnâ€™t enough time for us to even set up our own cameras (Thank you Mr. Professional Cameraman who made a  cameo in the background of this video! ğŸ˜‚), and having a proper meal in the middle of a press day wasnâ€™t going to be possible, we agreed that some Korean Snacks would be perfect to keep him going through the long day! So I chose some Korean snacks, snacks that my English friends have really loved, and we headed to Bali!!

Hello! Did you know Koreans invented so-called "mix coffee?" Today we introduce Korean "mix coffee" to our tea-drinking English friends. The culture of mix-coffee that you can find in about half of all restaurants in Korea is unlike anything I've seen anywhere else, but how will our English friends take to it?! Whether you are a coffee drinker or not mix-coffee in Korea is definitely worth a try!!!

Today we had the privilege to film with two living legends, Arnold Schwarzenegger and Linda Hamilton!!   We wanted to give them a great experience and a bit of an authentic taste of Korea in their short time here, so we prepared a traditional Korean full spread with some healthy main dishes to match Arnold's promotion of a healthy balanced diet! We had no idea what to expect filming with these two, and were so smitten with Linda's sweet charm and impressed and a little bit scared by Arnold's raw charisma!!!

And not only do they deliver, but they have a secret hidden menu that I havenâ€™t seen anywhere else before!! So of course, after a long day of being healthy, we sat down to rest at our hotel and ordered one of the least healthy things we could :D 
THIS IS NOT AN ADVERT FOR MCDONALDâ€™S!! 
Haha Seriously though, donâ€™t eat Mcdonaldâ€™s. I donâ€™t recommend it. That said Iâ€™m glad we got to show Chris this unique Mcdonald's experience in Korea, and show him the extent and variety of delivery food culture Korea!

Today we've got a special little video for you guys! Over the last few years we've had the incredible opportunity to introduce Korean food and parts of Korean culture to Celebrities from around the world who are visiting Korea for the first time. In their busy press schedules being able to give them this unique experience has been really special! So we wanted to take some of the most memorable special moments from these opportunities over the last few years and put it together for you guys! 

Because of the current pandemic we haven't been able to travel, and we've had to cancel a lot of our content plans for the year. It's made introducing Korean culture a bit harder than we had expected, and so while we prepare some new content from the UK (gonna be different! stay tuned!), we hope you enjoy these compilation videos as much as we enjoyed rewatching and editing them together!

This week we take Johnny to have the meal of his dreams: Giant Crab, Monster Lobster, Huge Shrimp and live octopus all at once. This is what we came all the way to Womido in Incheon for, and it did NOT disappoint. We chose the seafood live from the Seafood market (while getting chased around by octopus wielding ajuaas), and then had it immediately prepared on the spot and presented to us alongside some beautiful chili sauce and Soju. This is as fresh as it gets, and one of our most memorable meals in Korea. Enjoy!

Last video we left Seoul and the boys had the time of their lives at a Korean water park, Bobby had his first ever boat ride and we all got KO'ed by Thanos... But it wouldn't be a proper day of fun on the water without ending it with the perfect Korean camping combo...

Big shout out to Sir.Loin for sending us some incredible Hanwoo (Korean Beef) for the boys, sponsoring this episode, and helping us make this trip possible!
